roleset.name: falsify slightly

example.name: prepositional arg1
example.text: So many people fudge on answers about exercise, the president's council now uses specific criteria to determine what is considered vigorous: It must produce contractions of large muscle groups, must achieve 60% of maximum aerobic capacity and must be done three or more times a week for a minimum of 20 minutes.

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1
example.text: Just look back at the way they fudged and lied their way through the rescue operation .
example.arg: their way through the rescue operation

roleset.note: FUDGE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'fudge' based on sentences in wsj. No Verbnet entry. (from fudge.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: wierd usage
example.text: That would give agencies-1 ``less ability ... *trace*-1 to fudge over things,'' he told reporters.
